intro: Pedicularis pubescens, commonly known as the hairy lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, often in moist, shaded areas. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
